intro: Silene vulgaris f. ivanovicii, commonly known as the Ivanovicii campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing herb characterized by its simple, often hairy stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of five-petaled flowers. It is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in grassy areas or disturbed soils. This subspecies is noted for its distinct morphological features compared to the typical form of Silene vulgaris.
